answers.answer: It really depends on your prepregnancy weight and your dr. First baby I was 198lbs and gained 37lbs and no one said a word and I lost it all without hardly trying. This baby, back to 198lbs, I'm 21wks and gained only 13lbs so far and my dr doesn't care but the hospital says that's too much and that I should only gain 20lbs all up.

It all depends on your body. If the doctor is not telling you that you gained to much weight don't worry what others are saying. I gained 68 lbs with my first and 62 lbs with my second. My doctor told me that I was fine.

They recommend gaining between 25 and 35 lbs. Less if you start out overweight,more if you're underweight. Gaining too much can put you at risk for gestational diabetes, but if your doc/midwife isn't concerned than you're probably okay.  Just aim to make healthy choices, you really only need about 300 extra calories daily when pregnant.
I said something to my doctor she said your pregnant, I was just wondering because many people has been saying I'm huge!
I think it varies from woman to woman, with both of my first pregnancies I gained 35lbs all together, I haven't gained any yet but I'm only 10+6weeks at the moment

question: I'm almost 28 weeks and gained 55 pounds, is that a lot? When I found out at (8 weeks) we was pregnant I weighed 186 I didn't gain any weight for three months. Everyone thinks I'm to big or have twins but there's just one boy in there. Has anyone gained a lot?
title: weight gain
